intro: Lesquerella humilis, commonly known as the slender lesquerella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It produces capsule fruits containing seeds that are rich in oils, making it of interest for potential agricultural and industrial uses. Lesquerella humilis is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions and can withstand periods of drought.
